comment: His class consists of weekly assignments and 4 tests (proctored) like any other Accounting class, no final. Attending lectures and keeping up with assignments is important to keep your grade high and to keep up with the material. Amazing person and Professor all around. He answers emails quickly and gives lots of extra credit.

Best accounting professor I've had. He not only goes slow in class, but he is also very sweet and funny. He will go over homework problems in class which helped a lot. He gives a lot of extra credit just cuz. One time he gave 7 points just because the Braves won. His extra credit carried me in this class. He is not shy to go over something again.

Probably the best accounting professor you'll get! Accounting 2 is very very hard but if you go to his lectures he makes learning easier and fun. Loved his jokes as well. Super caring and gives many extra credit opportunities.

This is the only teacher I have ever written a review for. I want everyone to know that this is one of the best professors at KSU. Not only does he make a hard subject easier, but works through everything slowly so everyone understands. He is very kind and loves making jokes throughout the class. He also gives out so much extra credit just because.

this professor was great. he has silly jokes every day to help with the boringness of accounting but he's very attentive to everyones questions, he gives so much extra credit in this course and coming to class really helped me stay on top of the material. chose him if you get the chance.

Set the difficulty level as average because accounting is not a class you can just breeze by with any prof. He is super helpful if you ever need extra help, so nice, and he's actually good at teaching. I would 100% recommend him to anyone. Class is basically the same as as accounting 1 with weekly hw & quizzes but he goes over hw in class.

Caylor is enthusiastic about the material he teaches. At first, I didn't get the purpose of the class. But as we started to learn about IT general controls and auditing, it all came together. Attendance is not mandatory but he shares doc cam slides in class that are not posted to D2L. Tests are not difficult with moderate amount of study.

He made a boring class not so boring. His lectures are great. The exams are hard so study his guides and practice tests, but he gives very generous curves. There is a group project at the end of the semester that is very tedious, but he gives lots of hints and is more than willing to give feedback on it. Go to class, he gives lots of hints on tests

Love this teacher. Content was hard, but he helped anyway he could. Even kept us laughing with his jokes. Even on the assignments, he was easy to get up with and he helped as much as he could. Wonderful teacher. Take him! Better love the Braves - he gives extra credit based on how well they did (during baseball season). Literally my fav teacher!

He is honestly the nicest man ever. He is so lenient on grading and always so willing to help. He is a dream of a professor! Have to take him. His tests are very doable and he really prepares you for them. The projects were pretty easy and he helps a lot!

TAKE THIS PROFESSOR IF YOU CAN! He is so amazing and such a good teacher. Make sure to go to class whether it is online or on campus. Mentions doc cam slides that are usually on tests. Take good notes and read the textbook. Will almost always tell you what he is going to put on the test on the review days. Takes accounting to a new level! Take him!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: One of my favorite professors. He really tries to make his class interesting and engaging. The material can be overwhelming at times but he does a thorough review day so you are prepared on what to study.
Seriously one of the best professors in the accounting department. You should without a doubt take him for ACCT 3300.

I really disliked the content of the class, but Professor Caylor is definitely one of the best professors I have taken at KSU. He's friendly, has a great sense of humour, gives students good feedback on tests/assignments, and will really help you do well and make sure you have the tools to do so. Would 100% recommend and would 100% take him again.

You'll need to go to class because he'll write questions down in class called "doc cam slides" that will be on the exam. 3 tests and a cumulative final but there's projects in class that will add to your grade as well.

Great professor. Super nice, high energy, very animated, pretty funny, extremely invested in student learning and success. Only negative: lectures move very fast and are frequently supplemented with handwritten doc cam slides which often cant be downloaded or photographed. The constant transition between lecture mediums was sometimes difficult

This professor is one of the best I've had at KSU. Genuinely cares for his students and explains the material so well. Tests were so easy and straightforward. Explains exactly what will be on the test. Curved every test by so much. Read the book and take good notes and study them and you will be fine! Project is hard so get a good partner

He is really nice and knows the material very well. The class is tough but just master your flowcharts and the key terms and you'll be fine. But be prepared the beginning of each test had hard concept questions. He curved some of the tests. Project is lengthy but he will help you a lot! if you go to see him in his office. I would take him again.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS--Tests are tough

comment: Professor Caylor is a nice guy, a good professor, and a helpful educator. I give him top marks for care, concern, amicability, and maintaining structures. The only criticism I can lay is at the class, not him. The class needs to spend much more time on QuickBooks, Excel, and flowcharting for the CPA, and much less on memorizing business controls.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Study, study, study.  I will say this was one of the toughest classes I've had.  There is a lot of material crammed into one semester.  The project was not bad, it was the exams.  One good thing is he offers extra credit.
Very good professor overall. Fair grader. Explains things well. Cares about students.

Way to much crammed into one class to really learn any of it well.  Professor rushed through the Quick Books portion so be prepared to learn it on your own. He says he's available to help, but good-luck catching him in the office as his office hours are very limited.  He writes his own tests and they are more complex than study material.

Nice professor, always willing to help his students! 4 exams(not open book but he has practice tests on D2L that help, plus the PPT slides), 1 manual acct assign and 1 internal control assign, and a 2 person group project dealing with QuickBooks and flowcharts. Do not wait to work on it till the last min!

He's a great professor.  Always willing to help his students, especially with the HUGE project due at the end.  His tests are very long and challenging but not impossible.  The material can be a little dull but if you bite down and work hard an A is easily attainable.

Caylor is very helpful and tries to make boring information interesting. He's a bit all over the place, so not the best for ADHD students. Tests are pretty difficult, but he reviews, so pay attention for that. He will provide feedback on projects before the due date, so get finished early.

Boring class but he is a really nice guy. does his best to make you understand the material. there is a project that counts as a huge part of your grade. Pick a serious partner and dont end up like i did. Overall the class is not difficult.

A very good professor. He was extremely helpful and made the material interesting. Assignments were useful for preparing you for the world of Accounting as well as the tests for the class. Is quick when giving back grades and answering questions which is a very good thing.

Prof. Caylor is an awesome professor. He is really helpful and goes over all the material great. I would highly recommend him for this class and any others that he might teach. Always answered any questions that we had and would go over any material. Tests were long and lots of material but just study and you will do fine.

Caylor is great! He is so enthusiastic about the content that it makes it impossible not to pay attention. However that being said, he does talk the entire lecture and usually then some (by ten min). No homework, 4 long tests, large partnership project, participation points. Overall good, I would take him again. I personally did not use the text.

Dr. Caylor is a great guy and an awesome professor! He genuinely wants the class to do well. He curved every exam to maintain a low B average. Lots of material to cover and memorize for each exam. Offers great test reviews. The QuickBooks project wasn't too bad and he was always available to help during class and office hours. Take him!

Great professor, very nice and willing to help students if you ask. Material load is high, a lot of control plans/goals to memorize. One large project using QuickBooks but it is not difficult. Just keep up with the work and read the book. I got an A in the course.

One of my favorite professors at KSU.. he is so nice and helpful. He really wants all of his students to do good and will do anything to help. He makes class interesting when the material would be otherwise boring. Definitely recommend!!!!

He is very helpful and always has a great attitude. He is very helpful and nice to everyone. He curves a lot to help everyone. He also helps with everything that you turn in. definately go to review days because he goes through everything on the test.

He's the greatest professor I've ever had! He is so nice and he actually cares about his students. He tells you what to study for the tests, and curves them very generously. I would highly recommend him! A++++
